glsa.title: JHead: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in JHead might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or data loss.

background.p: JHead is an exif jpeg header manipulation tool.

description.p: Marc Merlin and John Dong reported multiple vulnerabilities in JHead:

ul.li: A buffer overflow in the DoCommand() function when processing the cmd argument and related to potential string overflows (CVE-2008-4575).
An insecure creation of a temporary file (CVE-2008-4639).
A error when unlinking a file (CVE-2008-4640).

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code by enticing a user or automated system to open a file with a long filename or via unspecified vectors. It is also possible to trick a user into deleting or overwriting files.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
